remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.DiscoveryVersion%2A> is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryVersion.WSDiscoveryApril2005> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.DiscoveryMode%2A> is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryMode.Managed>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.DiscoveryVersion%2A> is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryVersion.WSDiscoveryApril2005%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.DiscoveryMode%2A> is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.ServiceDiscoveryMode.Managed>.

The binding elements that specify the protocols, transports, and message encoders used for communication between clients and services.
The unique address of the discovery endpoint.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified discovery version, mode, binding, and endpoint address.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Discovery can be accomplished in two different modes: Ad-Hoc or Managed. [!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/includes/crdefault-md.md)][WCF Discovery Overview](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/wcf-discovery-overview.md)

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum within which all of the for a service that respond to a probe operation are sent.
Docs.value: A instance that contains the maximum time span within which all of the for a service that respond to a probe operation are sent.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value is a <xref:System.TimeSpan> that specifies a time span in which all `ProbeMatches` for a service that respond to a single probe operation are sent. If all `ProbeMatches` are sent at the same time, a network storm may result. To prevent this from occurring, `ProbeMatches` are sent with a random delay between each ProbeMatch. The random delay is in the range of 0 to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.MaxResponseDelay%2A>. If <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.MaxResponseDelay%2A> is set to 0, then the `ProbeMatches` messages are sent in a tight loop without any delay. Otherwise, the `ProbeMatches` messages are sent with some random delay such that the total time taken to send all `ProbeMatches` messages does not exceed the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.MaxResponseDelay%2A>. This value is only relevant for services, it is not used by clients.
